LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the alpha (opacity) of Face. Sets the alpha (opacity) value for Face. If Face is ALL_SIDES, sets the alpha for all faces. The alpha value is interpreted as an opacity percentage (1.0 is fully opaque, and 0.2 is mostly transparent). This function will clamp alpha values less than 0.1 to 0.1 and greater than 1.0 to 1.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetAngularVelocity
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets an object's angular velocity to AngVel, in local coordinates if Local == TRUE (if the script is physical). Has no effect on non-physical objects.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetAnimationOverride
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the animation (in object inventory) that will play for the given animation state. To use this function the script must obtain the PERMISSION_OVERRIDE_ANIMATIONS permission.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetBuoyancy
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set the tasks buoyancy (0 is none, < 1.0 sinks, 1.0 floats, > 1.0 rises). Set the object buoyancy. A value of 0 is none, less than 1.0 sinks, 1.0 floats, and greater than 1.0 rises.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetCameraAtOffset
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the camera used in this object, at offset, if an avatar sits on it. Sets the offset that an avatar's camera will be moved to if the avatar sits on the object.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetCameraEyeOffset
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the camera eye offset used in this object if an avatar sits on it.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetCameraParams
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets multiple camera parameters at once. List format is [ rule-1, data-1, rule-2, data-2 . . . rule-n, data-n ].

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetClickAction
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the action performed when a prim is clicked upon.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetColor
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the color, for the face. Sets the color of the side specified. If Face is ALL_SIDES, sets the color on all faces.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetContentType
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set the media type of an LSL HTTP server response to ContentType. HTTPRequestID must be a valid http_request ID. ContentType must be one of the CONTENT_TYPE_* constants.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetDamage
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the amount of damage that will be done to an avatar that this task hits. Task will be killed. Sets the amount of damage that will be done to an avatar that this object hits. This object will be destroyed on damaging an avatar, and no collision event is triggered.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetForce
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets Force on object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used). Only works on physical objects.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetForceAndTorque
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the Force and Torque of object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used). Only works on physical objects.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetHoverHeight
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Critically damps a physical object to a Height (either above ground level or above the higher of land and water if water == TRUE). Do not use with vehicles. Use llStopHover to stop hovering.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetInventoryPermMask
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the given permission mask to the new value on the inventory item.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetKeyframedMotion
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Requests that a non-physical object be key-framed according to key-frame list. Specify a list of times, positions, and orientations to be followed by an object. The object will be smoothly moved between key-frames by the simulator. Collisions with other non-physical or key-framed objects will be ignored (no script events will fire and collision processing will not occur). Collisions with physical objects will be computed and reported, but the key-framed object will be unaffected by those collisions. Keyframes is a strided list containing positional, rotational, and time data for each step in the motion. Options is a list containing optional arguments and parameters (specified by KFM_* constants).

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkAlpha
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If a prim exists in the link chain at LinkNumber, set Face to Opacity. Sets the Face, on the linked prim specified, to the Opacity.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkCamera
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the camera eye offset, and the offset that camera is looking at, for avatars that sit on the linked prim.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkColor
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If a task exists in the link chain at LinkNumber, set the Face to color. Sets the color of the linked child's side, specified by LinkNumber.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkMedia
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set the media parameters for a particular face on linked prim, specified by Link. Returns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s). MediaParameters is a set of name/value pairs in no particular order. Parameters not specified are unchanged, or if new media is added then set to the default specified.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkPrimitiveParams
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set primitive parameters for LinkNumber based on Parameters. Sets the parameters (or properties) of any linked prim in one step.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkPrimitiveParamsFast
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set primitive parameters for LinkNumber based on Parameters, without a delay. Set parameters for link number, from the list of Parameters, with no built-in script sleep. This function is identical to llSetLinkPrimitiveParams, except without the delay.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkTexture
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the Texture of Face on a linked prim, specified by LinkNumber. Texture may be a UUID or name of a texture in prim inventory.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLinkTextureAnim
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Animates a texture on the prim specified by LinkNumber, by setting the texture scale and offset. Mode is a bitmask of animation options. Face specifies which object face to animate. SizeX and SizeY specify the number of horizontal and vertical frames.Start specifes the animation start point. Length specifies the animation duration. Rate specifies the animation playback rate.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetLocalRot
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the rotation of a child prim relative to the root prim.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetMemoryLimit
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Requests Limit bytes to be reserved for this script. Returns TRUE or FALSE indicating whether the limit was set successfully. This function has no effect if the script is running in the LSO VM.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetObjectDesc
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the description of the prim to Description. The description field is limited to 127 characters.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetObjectName
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the prim's name to Name.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetObjectPermMask
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the specified PermissionFlag permission to the value specified by PermissionMask on the object the script is attached to.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetParcelMusicURL
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the streaming audio URL for the parcel the object is on. The object must be owned by the owner of the parcel; if the parcel is group owned the object must be owned by that group.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPayPrice
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the default amount when someone chooses to pay this object. Price is the default price shown in the textu input field. QuickButtons specifies the 4 payment values shown in the payment dialog's buttons. Input field and buttons may be hidden with PAY_HIDE constant, and may be set to their default values using PAY_DEFAULT.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPhysicsMaterial
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the selected parameters of the object's physics behavior. MaterialBits is a bitmask specifying which of the parameters in the other arguments should be applied to the object. GravityMultiplier, Restitution, Friction, and Density are the possible parameters to manipulate.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPos
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If the object is not physical, this function sets the position of the prim. If the script is in a child prim, Position is treated as root relative and the link-set is adjusted. If the prim is the root prim, the entire object is moved (up to 10m) to Position in region coordinates.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPrimitiveParams
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: This function changes the many properties (or "parameters") of a prim in one operation. Parameters is a list of changes.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPrimMediaParams
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the MediaParameters for a particular Face on the prim. Returns an integer that is a STATUS_* flag which details the success/failure of the operation(s). MediaParameters is a set of name/value pairs in no particular order. Parameters not specified are unchanged, or if new media is added then set to the default specified.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetPrimURL
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Use llSetPrimMediaParams instead.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetRegionPos
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Attempts to move the object so that the root prim is within 0.1m of Position. Returns an integer boolean, TRUE if the object is successfully placed within 0.1 m of Position, FALSE otherwise. Position may be any location within the region or up to 10m across a region border. If the position is below ground, it will be set to the ground level at that x,y location.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetRemoteScriptAccessPin
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If PIN is set to a non-zero number, the task will accept remote script loads via llRemoteLoadScriptPin() if it passes in the correct PIN. Othersise, llRemoteLoadScriptPin() is ignored.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetRot
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If the object is not physical, this function sets the rotation of the prim. If the script is in a child prim, Rotation is treated as root relative and the link-set is adjusted. If the prim is the root prim, the entire object is rotated to Rotation in the global reference frame.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetScale
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the prim's scale (size) to Scale.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetScriptState
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Enable or disable the script Running state of Script in the prim.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetSitText
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Displays Text rather than 'Sit' in the viewer's context menu.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetSoundQueueing
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets whether successive calls to llPlaySound, llLoopSound, etc., (attached sounds) interrupt the currently playing sound. The default for objects is FALSE. Setting this value to TRUE will make the sound wait until the current playing sound reaches its end. The queue is one level deep.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetSoundRadius
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Limits radius for audibility of scripted sounds (both attached and triggered) to distance Radius.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetStatus
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets object status specified in Status bitmask (e.g. STATUS_PHYSICS|STATUS_PHANTOM) to boolean Value. For a full list of STATUS_* constants, see wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetText
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Causes Text to float above the prim, using the specified Color and Opacity.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetTexture
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Applies Texture to Face of prim. Texture may be a UUID or name of a texture in prim inventory. If Face is ALL_SIDES, set the texture on all faces.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetTextureAnim
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Animates a texture by setting the texture scale and offset. Mode is a bitmask of animation options. Face specifies which object face to animate. SizeX and SizeY specify the number of horizontal and vertical frames.Start specifes the animation start point. Length specifies the animation duration. Rate specifies the animation playback rate.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetTimerEvent
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Causes the timer event to be triggered every Rate seconds. Passing in 0.0 stops further timer events.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetTorque
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets the Torque acting on the script's object, in object-local coordinates if Local == TRUE (otherwise, the region reference frame is used). Only works on physical objects.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetTouchText
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Displays Text in the viewer context menu that acts on a touch.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVehicleFlags
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Enables the vehicle flags specified in the Flags bitmask. Valid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVehicleFloatParam
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets a vehicle float parameter. Valid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVehicleRotationParam
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets a vehicle rotation parameter. Valid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVehicleType
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Activates the vehicle action on the object with vehicle preset Type. Valid Types and an explanation of their characteristics can be found in wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVehicleVectorParam
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Sets a vehicle vector parameter. Valid parameters can be found in the wiki documentation.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSetVelocity
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If the object is physics-enabled, sets the object's linear velocity to Velocity. If Local==TRUE, Velocity is treated as a local directional vector; otherwise, Velocity is treated as a global directional vector.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSHA1String
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns a string of 40 hex characters that is the SHA1 security Hash of Text.

LibraryFunction.Name: llShout
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Shouts Text on Channel. This chat method has a range of 100m radius. PUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSin
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the sine of Theta (Theta in radians).

LibraryFunction.Name: llSitTarget
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Set the sit location for this object. If offset == ZERO_VECTOR, clears the sit target.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSleep
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Put script to sleep for Time seconds.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSound
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Use llPlaySound instead. Plays Sound at Volume and specifies whether the sound should loop and/or be enqueued.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSoundPreload
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Use llPreloadSound instead. Preloads a sound on viewers within range.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSqrt
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the square root of Value. Triggers a math runtime error for imaginary results (if Value < 0.0).

LibraryFunction.Name: llStartAnimation
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: This function plays the specified animation from playing on the avatar who received the script's most recent permissions request. Animation may be an animation in task inventory or a built-in animation. Requires PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION.

LibraryFunction.Name: llStopAnimation
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: This function stops the specified animation on the avatar who received the script's most recent permissions request. Animation may be an animation in task inventory, a built-in animation, or the uuid of an animation. Requires PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION.

LibraryFunction.Name: llStopHover
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Stop hovering to a height (due to llSetHoverHeight()).

LibraryFunction.Name: llStopLookAt
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Stop causing object to point at a target (due to llLookAt() or llRotLookAt()).

LibraryFunction.Name: llStopMoveToTarget
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Stops critically damped motion (due to llMoveToTarget()).

LibraryFunction.Name: llStopSound
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Stops playback of the currently attached sound.

LibraryFunction.Name: llStringLength
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns an integer that is the number of characters in Text (not counting the null).

LibraryFunction.Name: llStringToBase64
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the string Base64 representation of the input string.

LibraryFunction.Name: llStringTrim
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Outputs a string, eliminating white-space from the start and/or end of the input string Text. Valid options for TrimType: STRING_TRIM_HEAD: trim all leading spaces in Text STRING_TRIM_TAIL: trim all trailing spaces in Text STRING_TRIM: trim all leading and trailing spaces in Text.

LibraryFunction.Name: llSubStringIndex
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns an integer that is the index in Text where string pattern Sequence first appears. Returns -1 if not found.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTakeCamera
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Use llSetCameraParams instead.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTakeControls
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Take controls from the agent the script has permissions for. If (Accept == (Controls & input)), send input to the script. PassOn determines whether Controls also perform their normal functions. Requires the PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS permission to run.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTan
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the tangent of Theta (Theta in radians).

LibraryFunction.Name: llTarget
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: This function is to have the script know when it has reached a position. It registers a Position with a Range that triggers at_target and not_at_target events continuously until unregistered.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTargetOmega
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Attempt to spin at SpinRate with strength Gain on Axis. A spin rate of 0.0 cancels the spin. This function always works in object-local coordinates.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTargetRemove
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Removes positional target Handle registered with llTarget.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTeleportAgent
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Requests a teleport of avatar to a landmark stored in the object's inventory. If no landmark is provided (an empty string), the avatar is teleported to the location position in the current region. In either case, the avatar is turned to face the position given by look_at in local coordinates. Requires the PERMISSION_TELEPORT permission. This function can only teleport the owner of the object.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTeleportAgentGlobalCoords
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Teleports an agent to the RegionPosition local coordinates within a region which is specified by the GlobalPosition global coordinates. The agent lands facing the position defined by LookAtPoint local coordinates. Requires the PERMISSION_TELEPORT permission. This function can only teleport the owner of the object.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTeleportAgentHome
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Teleport agent over the owner's land to agent's home location.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTextBox
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Opens a dialog for the specified avatar with message Text, which contains a text box for input. Any text that is entered is said on the specified Channel (as if by the avatar) when the "OK" button is clicked.

LibraryFunction.Name: llToLower
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns a string that is Text with all lower-case characters.

LibraryFunction.Name: llToUpper
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns a string that is Text with all upper-case characters.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTransferLindenDollars
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Transfer Amount of linden dollars (L$) from script owner to AvatarID. Returns a key to a corresponding transaction_result event for the success of the transfer. Attempts to send the amount of money to the specified avatar, and trigger a transaction_result event identified by the returned key.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTriggerSound
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Plays Sound at Volume (0.0 - 1.0), centered at but not attached to object. There is no limit to the number of triggered sounds which can be generated by an object, and calling llTriggerSound does not affect the attached sounds created by llPlaySound and llLoopSound. This is very useful for things like collision noises, explosions, etc. There is no way to stop or alter the volume of a sound triggered by this function.

LibraryFunction.Name: llTriggerSoundLimited
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Plays Sound at Volume (0.0 - 1.0), centered at but not attached to object, limited to axis-aligned bounding box defined by vectors top-north-east (TNE) and bottom-south-west (BSW). There is no limit to the number of triggered sounds which can be generated by an object, and calling llTriggerSound does not affect the attached sounds created by llPlaySound and llLoopSound. This is very useful for things like collision noises, explosions, etc. There is no way to stop or alter the volume of a sound triggered by this function.

LibraryFunction.Name: llUnescapeURL
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the string that is the URL unescaped, replacing "%20" with spaces, etc., version of URL. This function can output raw UTF-8 strings.

LibraryFunction.Name: llUnSit
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If agent identified by AvatarID is sitting on the object the script is attached to or is over land owned by the objects owner, the agent is forced to stand up.

LibraryFunction.Name: llUpdateCharacter
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Updates settings for a pathfinding character.

LibraryFunction.Name: llVecDist
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the distance between Location1 and Location2.

LibraryFunction.Name: llVecMag
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns the magnitude of the vector.

LibraryFunction.Name: llVecNorm
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Returns normalized vector.

LibraryFunction.Name: llVolumeDetect
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: If DetectEnabled = TRUE, object becomes phantom but triggers collision_start and collision_end events when other objects start and stop interpenetrating. If another object (including avatars) interpenetrates it, it will get a collision_start event. When an object stops interpenetrating, a collision_end event is generated. While the other is inter-penetrating, collision events are NOT generated.

LibraryFunction.Name: llWanderWithin

LibraryFunction.Name: llWater

LibraryFunction.Name: llWhisper
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Whispers Text on Channel. This chat method has a range of 10m radius. PUBLIC_CHANNEL is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. DEBUG_CHANNEL is the script debug channel, and is also visible to nearby avatars. All other channels are are not sent to avatars, but may be used to communicate with scripts.

LibraryFunction.Name: llWind

LibraryFunction.Name: llXorBase64

LibraryFunction.Name: llXorBase64Strings
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Please use llXorBase64 instead. Incorrectly performs an exclusive OR on two Base64 strings and returns a Base64 string. Text2 repeats if it is shorter than Text1. Retained for backwards compatibility.

LibraryFunction.Name: llXorBase64StringsCorrect
LibraryFunction.DocumentationString: Deprecated: Please use llXorBase64 instead. Correctly (unless nulls are present) performs an exclusive OR on two Base64 strings and returns a Base64 string. Text2 repeats if it is shorter than Text1.

EventHandler.Name: at_rot_target
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered when a script comes within a defined angle of a target rotation. The range and rotation, are set by a call to llRotTarget.

EventHandler.Name: at_target
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered when the scripted object comes within a defined range of the target position, defined by the llTarget function call.

EventHandler.Name: attach
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered whenever an object is attached or detached from an avatar. If it is attached, the key of the avatar it is attached to is passed in, otherwise NULL_KEY is.

EventHandler.Name: changed
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered when various events change the object. The change argument will be a bit-field of CHANGED_* constants.

EventHandler.Name: collision
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised while another object, or avatar, is colliding with the object the script is attached to. The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* functions.

EventHandler.Name: collision_end
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when another object, or avatar, stops colliding with the object the script is attached to. The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

EventHandler.Name: collision_start
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when another object, or avatar, starts colliding with the object the script is attached to. The number of detected objects is passed to the script. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

EventHandler.Name: control
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Once a script has the ability to grab control inputs from the avatar, this event will be used to pass the commands into the script. The levels and edges are bit-fields of control constants.

EventHandler.Name: dataserver
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered when the requested data is returned to the script. Data may be requested by the llRequestAgentData, llRequestInventoryData, and llGetNotecardLine function calls, for example.

EventHandler.Name: email
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered when an email sent to this script arrives. The number remaining tells how many more emails are known to be still pending.

EventHandler.Name: http_request
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered when task receives an HTTP request.

EventHandler.Name: http_response
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event handler is invoked when an HTTP response is received for a pending llHTTPRequest request or if a pending request fails or times out.

EventHandler.Name: land_collision
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to is colliding with the ground.

EventHandler.Name: land_collision_end
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to stops colliding with the ground.

EventHandler.Name: land_collision_start
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when the object the script is attached to begins to collide with the ground.

EventHandler.Name: link_message
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered when object receives a link message via llMessageLinked function call.

EventHandler.Name: listen
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised whenever a chat message matching the constraints set in the llListen command is received. The name and ID of the speaker, as well as the message, are passed in as parameters. Channel 0 is the public chat channel that all avatars see as chat text. Channels 1 through 2,147,483,648 are private channels that are not sent to avatars but other scripts can listen on those channels.

EventHandler.Name: money
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is triggered when a resident has given an amount of Linden dollars to the object.

EventHandler.Name: moving_end
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered whenever an object with this script stops moving.

EventHandler.Name: moving_start
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered whenever an object with this script starts moving.

EventHandler.Name: no_sensor
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when sensors are active, via the llSensor function call, but are not sensing anything.

EventHandler.Name: not_at_rot_target
EventHandler.DocumentationString: When a target is set via the llRotTarget function call, but the script is outside the specified angle this event is raised.

EventHandler.Name: not_at_target
EventHandler.DocumentationString: When a target is set via the llTarget library call, but the script is outside the specified range this event is raised.

EventHandler.Name: object_rez
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered when an object rezzes another object from its inventory via the llRezObject, or similar, functions. The id is the globally unique key for the object rezzed.

EventHandler.Name: on_rez
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered whenever an object is rezzed from inventory or by another object. The start parameter is passed in from the llRezObject call, or zero if from inventory.

EventHandler.Name: path_update
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is called to inform the script of changes within the object's path-finding status.

EventHandler.Name: remote_data
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered by various XML-RPC calls with event_type specifying the type of data.

EventHandler.Name: run_time_permissions
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Scripts need permission from either the owner or the avatar they wish to act on before they may perform certain functions, such as debiting money from their owners account, triggering an animation on an avatar, or capturing control inputs. The llRequestPermissions library function is used to request these permissions and the various permissions integer constants can be supplied. The integer returned to this event handler contains the current set of permissions flags, so if permissions equal 0 then no permissions are set.

EventHandler.Name: sensor
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised whenever objects matching the constraints of the llSensor command are detected. The number of detected objects is passed to the script in the parameter. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* functions.

EventHandler.Name: state_entry
EventHandler.DocumentationString: The state_entry event occurs whenever a new state is entered, including at program start, and is always the first event handled.

EventHandler.Name: state_exit
EventHandler.DocumentationString: The state_exit event occurs whenever the state command is used to transition to another state. It is handled before the new states state_entry event.

EventHandler.Name: timer
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised at regular intervals set by the llSetTimerEvent library function.

EventHandler.Name: touch
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised while a user is touching the object the script is attached to. The number of touching objects is passed to the script in the parameter. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

EventHandler.Name: touch_end
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when a user stops touching the object the script is attached to. The number of touches is passed to the script in the parameter. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected* library functions.

EventHandler.Name: touch_start
EventHandler.DocumentationString: This event is raised when a user first touches the object the script is attached to. The number of touches is passed to the script in the parameter. Information on those objects may be gathered via the llDetected() library functions.

EventHandler.Name: transaction_result
EventHandler.DocumentationString: Triggered by llTransferMoney() function.
