LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RHAND
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right hand.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RHIP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right hip.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RIGHT_PEC
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right pectoral.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RLARM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right lower arm.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RLLEG
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right lower leg.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RPEC
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's left pectoral. (deprecated, use ATTACH_LEFT_PEC)

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RSHOULDER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right shoulder.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RUARM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right upper arm.

LibraryConstant.Name: ATTACH_RULEG
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Attach to the avatar's right upper leg.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_ALLOWED_DROP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object inventory has changed because an item was added through the llAllowInventoryDrop interface.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object color has changed.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_INVENTORY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object inventory has changed.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_LINK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object has linked or its links were broken.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object scale (size) has changed.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_SHAPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The object base shape has changed, e.g., a box to a cylinder.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_TEXTURE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The texture offset, scale rotation, or simply the object texture has changed.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_ACCOUNT_FOR_SKIPPED_FRAMES
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If set to false, character will not attempt to catch up on lost time when pathfinding performance is low, potentially providing more reliable movement (albeit while potentially appearing to be more stuttery). Default is true to match pre-existing behavior.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_AVOIDANCE_MODE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Allows you to specify that a character should not try to avoid other characters, should not try to avoid dynamic obstacles (relatively fast moving objects and avatars), or both.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_CMD_JUMP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Makes the character jump. Requires an additional parameter, the height to jump, between 0.1m and 2.0m. This must be provided as the first element of the llExecCharacterCmd option list.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_CMD_STOP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Stops any current pathfinding operation.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_DESIRED_SPEED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Speed of pursuit in meters per second.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_DESIRED_TURN_SPEED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The character's maximum speed while turning about the Z axis. - Note that this is only loosely enforced.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_LENGTH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Set collision capsule length - cannot be less than two times the radius.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_MAX_ACCEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The character's maximum acceleration rate.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_MAX_DECEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The character's maximum deceleration rate.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_MAX_SPEED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The character's maximum speed.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_MAX_TURN_RADIUS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The character's turn radius when travelling at CHARACTER_MAX_TURN_SPEED.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_ORIENTATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Valid options are: VERTICAL, HORIZONTAL.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_RADIUS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Set collision capsule radius.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_STAY_WITHIN_PARCEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Determines whether a character can leave its starting parcel. Takes a boolean parameter. If TRUE, the character cannot voluntarilly leave the parcel, but can return to it.

LibraryConstant.Name: CHARACTER_TYPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Specifies which walk-ability coefficient will be used by this character.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_BUY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, the buy dialog is opened.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_NONE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Performs the default action: when the prim is clicked, touch events are triggered.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_OPEN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, the object inventory dialog is opened.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_OPEN_MEDIA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is touched, the web media dialog is opened.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_PAY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, the pay dialog is opened.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_PLAY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, html-on-a-prim is enabled?

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_SIT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, the avatar sits upon it.

LibraryConstant.Name: CLICK_ACTION_TOUCH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: When the prim is clicked, touch events are triggered.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_ATOM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/atom+xml"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_FORM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/x-www-form-urlencoded"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_HTML
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "text/html", only valid for embedded browsers on content owned by the person viewing. Falls back to "text/plain" otherwise.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_JSON
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/json"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_LLSD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/llsd+xml"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_RSS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/rss+xml"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_TEXT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "text/plain"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_XHTML
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/xhtml+xml"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTENT_TYPE_XML
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: "application/xml"

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_BACK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move back control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_DOWN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move down control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_FWD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move forward control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_LBUTTON
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar left button control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_LEFT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move left control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_ML_LBUTTON
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar left button control while in mouse look.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_RIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move right control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_ROT_LEFT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar rotate left control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_ROT_RIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar rotate right control.

LibraryConstant.Name: CONTROL_UP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Test for the avatar move up control.

LibraryConstant.Name: DATA_BORN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The date the agent was born, returned in ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

LibraryConstant.Name: DATA_NAME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The name of the agent.

LibraryConstant.Name: DATA_ONLINE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: TRUE for online, FALSE for offline.

LibraryConstant.Name: DATA_RATING
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns the agent ratings as a comma separated string of six integers. They are: (1 Positive rated behaviour) (2 Negative rated behaviour) (3 Positive rated appearance) (4 Negative rated appearance) (5 Positive rated building) (6 Negative rated building)

LibraryConstant.Name: DEBUG_CHANNEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: DEBUG_CHANNEL is an integer constant that, when passed to llSay, llWhisper, or llShout as a channel parameter, will print text to the Script Warning/Error Window.

LibraryConstant.Name: DEG_TO_RAD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 0.01745329 - Number of radians per degree. You can use this to convert degrees to radians by multiplying the degrees by this number.

LibraryConstant.Name: DENSITY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the density value. Must be between 1.0 and 22587.0 (in Kg/m^3 -- see if you can figure out what 22587 represents)

LibraryConstant.Name: EOF
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Indicates the last line of a notecard was read.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_AGENT_ADD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Add the agent to this estate's Allowed Residents list.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_AGENT_REMOVE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Remove the agent from this estate's Allowed Residents list.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_GROUP_ADD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Add the group to this estate's Allowed groups list.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_ALLOWED_GROUP_REMOVE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Remove the group from this estate's Allowed groups list.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_BANNED_AGENT_ADD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Add the agent to this estate's Banned residents list.

LibraryConstant.Name: ESTATE_ACCESS_BANNED_AGENT_REMOVE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Remove the agent from this estate's Banned residents list.

LibraryConstant.Name: FALSE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: An integer constant for boolean comparisons. Has the value '0'.

LibraryConstant.Name: FORCE_DIRECT_PATH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Makes character navigate in a straight line toward position. May be set to TRUE or FALSE.

LibraryConstant.Name: FRICTION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the friction value. Must be between 0.0 and 255.0

LibraryConstant.Name: GRAVITY_MULTIPLIER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the gravity multiplier value. Must be between -1.0 and +28.0

LibraryConstant.Name: HTTP_CUSTOM_HEADER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Add an extra custom HTTP header to the request. The first string is the name of the parameter to change, e.g. "Pragma", and the second string is the value, e.g. "no-cache". Up to 8 custom headers may be configured per request. Note that certain headers, such as the default headers, are blocked for security reasons.

LibraryConstant.Name: HTTP_PRAGMA_NO_CACHE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Allows enabling/disabling of the "Pragma: no-cache" header. Usage: [HTTP_PRAGMA_NO_CACHE, integer SendHeader]. When SendHeader is TRUE, the "Pragma: no-cache" header is sent by the script. This matches the default behavior. When SendHeader is FALSE, no "Pragma" header is sent by the script.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_CMD_PAUSE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_COMMAND.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_CMD_PLAY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_COMMAND.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_CMD_STOP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_COMMAND.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_FORWARD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_MODE.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_LOOP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_MODE.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_PING_PONG
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_MODE.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_REVERSE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_MODE.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_ROTATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_DATA.

LibraryConstant.Name: KFM_TRANSLATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For use with KFM_DATA.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_LARGE_BRUSH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use a large brush size. NOTE: This value is incorrect, a large brush should be 2.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_LEVEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Action to level the land.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_LOWER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Action to lower the land.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_MEDIUM_BRUSH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use a medium brush size. NOTE: This value is incorrect, a medium brush should be 1.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_RAISE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Action to raise the land.

LibraryConstant.Name: LAND_SMALL_BRUSH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use a small brush size. NOTE: This value is incorrect, a small brush should be 0.

LibraryConstant.Name: LINK_ALL_CHILDREN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This targets every object except the root in the linked set.

LibraryConstant.Name: LINK_ALL_OTHERS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This targets every object in the linked set except the object with the script.

LibraryConstant.Name: LINK_ROOT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This targets the root of the linked set.

LibraryConstant.Name: LINK_SET
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This targets every object in the linked set.

LibraryConstant.Name: LINK_THIS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The link number of the prim containing the script.

LibraryConstant.Name: LOOP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Loop the texture animation.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_ATTACHED_POINT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the attachment point to which the object is attached. Returns 0 if the object is not an attachment (or is an avatar, etc).

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_CHARACTER_TIME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Units in seconds

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_CREATOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's creator key. If id is an avatar, a NULL_KEY is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_DESC
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's description. If id is an avatar, an empty string is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_GROUP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the prims's group key. If id is an avatar, a NULL_KEY is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_NAME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's name.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_OWNER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets an object's owner's key. If id is group owned, a NULL_KEY is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_PATHFINDING_TYPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns the pathfinding setting of any object in the region. It returns an integer matching one of the OPT_* constants.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_PHANTOM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns boolean, detailing if phantom is enabled or disabled on the object. If id is an avatar or attachment, 0 is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_PHYSICS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns boolean, detailing if physics is enabled or disabled on the object. If id is an avatar or attachment, 0 is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_POS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's position in region coordinates.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_RENDER_WEIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This is a flag used with llGetObjectDetails to get the Avatar_Rendering_Cost of an avatar, based on values reported by nearby viewers. If no data is available, -1 is returned. The maximum render weight stored by the simulator is 500000. When called against an object, 0 is returned.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_ROOT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the id of the root prim of the object requested. If id is an avatar, return the id of the root prim of the linkset the avatar is sitting on (or the avatar's own id if the avatar is not sitting on an object within the region).

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_ROT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's rotation.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_TEMP_ON_REZ
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns boolean, detailing if temporary is enabled or disabled on the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: OBJECT_VELOCITY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Gets the object's velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_AVATAR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for avatars.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_CHARACTER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for pathfinding characters.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_EXCLUSION_VOLUME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for exclusion volumes.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_LEGACY_LINKSET
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for movable obstacles, movable phantoms, physical, and volumedetect objects.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_MATERIAL_VOLUME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for material volumes.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_OTHER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for attachments, Linden trees, and grass.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_STATIC_OBSTACLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for static obstacles.

LibraryConstant.Name: OPT_WALKABLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returned for walkable objects.

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_AREA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The parcel's area, in square meters. (5 chars.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_DESC
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The description of the parcel. (127 chars).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_GROUP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The parcel group's key. (36 chars.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_ID
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The parcel's key. (36 chars.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_NAME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The name of the parcel. (63 chars.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_OWNER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The parcel owner's key. (36 chars.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_DETAILS_SEE_AVATARS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The parcel's avatar visibility setting. (1 char.).

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_DESC
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use this to get or set the parcel media description.

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_LOOP_SET
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Used to get or set the parcel's media looping variable.

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_SIZE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use this to get or set the parcel media pixel resolution.

LibraryConstant.Name: PARCEL_MEDIA_COMMAND_TYPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use this to get or set the parcel media MIME type (e.g. "text/html").

LibraryConstant.Name: PASSIVE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Static in-world objects.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_ATTACH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llAttachToAvatar to attach to the given avatar.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_JOINTS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: (not yet implemented)

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_LINKS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llCreateLink, llBreakLink, and llBreakAllLinks to change links to other objects.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_CHANGE_PERMISSIONS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: (not yet implemented)

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_DEBIT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llGiveMoney or llTransferLindenDollars to debit the owners account.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_OVERRIDE_ANIMATIONS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Permission to override default animations.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_RELEASE_OWNERSHIP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: (not yet implemented)

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_REMAP_CONTROLS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: (not yet implemented)

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_SILENT_ESTATE_MANAGEMENT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A script with this permission does not notify the object owner when it modifies estate access rules via llManageEstateAccess.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_TAKE_CONTROLS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If this permission enabled, the object can successfully call the llTakeControls libray call.

LibraryConstant.Name: PERMISSION_TRIGGER_ANIMATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: If this permission is enabled, the object can successfully call llStartAnimation for the avatar that owns this.

LibraryConstant.Name: PI
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 3.14159265 - The number of radians in a semi-circle.

LibraryConstant.Name: PI_BY_TWO
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 1.57079633 - The number of radians in a quarter circle.

LibraryConstant.Name: PING_PONG
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Play animation going forwards, then backwards.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_GLOW
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: PRIM_GLOW is used to get or set the glow status of the face.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_ALT_IMAGE_ENABLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets the default image state (the image that the user sees before a piece of media is active) for the chosen face. The default image is specified by Second Life's server for that media type.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_LOOP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether auto-looping is enabled.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_PLAY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether the media auto-plays when a Resident can view it.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether auto-scaling is enabled. Auto-scaling forces the media to the full size of the texture.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_AUTO_ZOOM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether clicking the media triggers auto-zoom and auto-focus on the media.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Integer. Gets/Sets the style of controls. Can be either PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_STANDARD or PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_MINI.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_MINI
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Mini web navigation controls; does not include an address bar.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_CONTROLS_STANDARD
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Standard web navigation controls.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_CURRENT_URL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: String. Gets/Sets the current url displayed on the chosen face. Changing this URL causes navigation. 1024 characters Maximum.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_FIRST_CLICK_INTERACT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether the first click interaction is enabled.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_HEIGHT_PIXELS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Integer. Gets/Sets the height of the media in pixels.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_HOME_URL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: String. Gets/Sets the home URL for the chosen face. 1024 characters maximum.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_PERMS_CONTROL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Integer. Gets/Sets the permissions mask that control who can see the media control bar above the object:: PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_ANYONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_GROUP, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_NONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_OWNER

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_PERMS_INTERACT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Integer. Gets/Sets the permissions mask that control who can interact with the object: PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_ANYONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_GROUP, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_NONE, PRIM_MEDIA_PERM_OWNER

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: String. Gets/Sets the white-list as a string of escaped, comma-separated URLs. This string can hold up to 64 URLs or 1024 characters, whichever comes first.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST_ENABLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Boolean. Gets/Sets whether navigation is restricted to URLs in PRIM_MEDIA_WHITELIST.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_MEDIA_WIDTH_PIXELS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Integer. Gets/Sets the width of the media in pixels.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_CONVEX
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use the convex hull of the prim shape for physics (this is the default for mesh objects).

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_NONE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Ignore this prim in the physics shape. NB: This cannot be applied to the root prim.

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_PRIM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Use the normal prim shape for physics (this is the default for all non-mesh objects).

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_TYPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Allows you to set the physics shape type of a prim via lsl. Permitted values are: PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_NONE, PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_PRIM, PRIM_PHYSICS_SHAPE_CONVEX

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_SCULPT_FLAG_INVERT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Render inside out (inverts the normals).

LibraryConstant.Name: PRIM_SCULPT_FLAG_MIRROR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Render an X axis mirror of the sculpty.

LibraryConstant.Name: PROFILE_NONE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Disables profiling

LibraryConstant.Name: PROFILE_SCRIPT_MEMORY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Enables memory profiling

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_BOUNCE_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Particles bounce off of a plane at the objects Z height.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_EMISSIVE_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The particle glows.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_END_ALPHA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A float which determines the ending alpha of the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_END_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector <r, g, b> which determines the ending color of the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_END_SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector <sx, sy, z>, which is the ending size of the particle billboard in meters (z is ignored).

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_FLAGS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Each particle that is emitted by the particle system is simulated based on the following flags. To use multiple flags, bitwise or (|) them together.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_FOLLOW_SRC_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The particle position is relative to the source objects position.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_FOLLOW_VELOCITY_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The particle orientation is rotated so the vertical axis faces towards the particle velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_INTERP_COLOR_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Interpolate both the color and alpha from the start value to the end value.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_INTERP_SCALE_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Interpolate the particle scale from the start value to the end value.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_MAX_AGE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Age in seconds of a particle at which it dies.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_START_ALPHA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A float which determines the starting alpha of the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_START_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector <r.r, g.g, b.b> which determines the starting color of the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_START_SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector <sx, sy, z>, which is the starting size of the particle billboard in meters (z is ignored).

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_TARGET_POS_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The particle heads towards the location of the target object as defined by PSYS_SRC_TARGET_KEY.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_PART_WIND_MASK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Particles have their velocity damped towards the wind velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_ACCEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector <x, y, z> which is the acceleration to apply on particles.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Area in radians specifying where particles will NOT be created (for ANGLE patterns)

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_END
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Area in radians filled with particles (for ANGLE patterns) (if lower than PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN, acts as PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN itself, and PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_BEGIN acts as PSYS_SRC_ANGLE_END).

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_PART_COUNT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: How many particles to release in a burst.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_RADIUS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: What distance from the center of the object to create the particles.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_RATE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: How often to release a particle burst (float seconds).

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_SPEED_MAX
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Maximum speed that a particle should be moving.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_BURST_SPEED_MIN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Minimum speed that a particle should be moving.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Specifies the inner angle of the arc created by the PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE or PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE source pattern. The area specified will NOT have particles in it.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_MAX_AGE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: How long this particle system should last, 0.0 means forever.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_OMEGA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Sets the angular velocity to rotate the axis that SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE and SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE use.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Specifies the outer angle of the arc created by the PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE or PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE source pattern. The area between the outer and inner angle will be filled with particles.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The pattern which is used to generate particles. Use one of the following values: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN Values.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Shoot particles across a 2 dimensional area defined by the arc created from PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE. There will be an open area defined by PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE within the larger arc.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_ANGLE_CONE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Shoot particles out in a 3 dimensional cone with an outer arc of PSYS_SRC_OUTERANGLE and an inner open area defined by PSYS_SRC_INNERANGLE.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_DROP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Drop particles at the source position.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_PATTERN_EXPLODE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Shoot particles out in all directions, using the burst parameters.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_TARGET_KEY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The key of a target object to move towards if PSYS_PART_TARGET_POS_MASK is enabled.

LibraryConstant.Name: PSYS_SRC_TEXTURE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: An asset name for the texture to use for the particles.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_EVADE_HIDDEN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Triggered when an llEvade character thinks it has hidden from its pursuer.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_EVADE_SPOTTED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Triggered when an llEvade character switches from hiding to running

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_INVALID_GOAL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Goal is not on the navigation-mesh and cannot be reached.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_INVALID_START
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Character cannot navigate from the current location - e.g., the character is off the navmesh or too high above it.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_NO_NAVMESH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This is a fatal error reported to a character when there is no navmesh for the region. This usually indicates a server failure and users should file a bug report and include the time and region in which they received this message.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_NO_VALID_DESTINATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: There is no good place for the character to go - e.g., it is patrolling and all the patrol points are now unreachable.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_TARGET_GONE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Target (for llPursue or llEvade) can no longer be tracked - e.g., it left the region or is an avatar that is now more than about 30m outside the region.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_FAILURE_UNREACHABLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Goal is no longer reachable for some reason - e.g., an obstacle blocks the path.

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_GOAL_REACHED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Character has reached the goal and will stop or choose a new goal (if wandering).

LibraryConstant.Name: PU_SLOWDOWN_DISTANCE_REACHED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Character is near current goal.

LibraryConstant.Name: PUBLIC_CHANNEL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: PUBLIC_CHANNEL is an integer constant that, when passed to llSay, llWhisper, or llShout as a channel parameter, will print text to the publicly heard chat channel.

LibraryConstant.Name: PURSUIT_FUZZ_FACTOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Selects a random destination near the offset.

LibraryConstant.Name: PURSUIT_INTERCEPT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Define whether the character attempts to predict the target's location.

LibraryConstant.Name: PURSUIT_OFFSET
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Go to a position offset from the target.

LibraryConstant.Name: RAD_TO_DEG
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 57.2957795 - Number of degrees per radian. You can use this number to convert radians to degrees by multiplying the radians by this number.

LibraryConstant.Name: REQUIRE_LINE_OF_SIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Define whether the character needs a line-of-sight to give chase.

LibraryConstant.Name: RESTITUTION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Used with llSetPhysicsMaterial to enable the density value. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0

LibraryConstant.Name: REVERSE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Play animation in reverse direction.

LibraryConstant.Name: ROTATE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Animate texture rotation.

LibraryConstant.Name: SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Animate the texture scale.

LibraryConstant.Name: SCRIPTED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Scripted in-world objects.

LibraryConstant.Name: SIM_STAT_PCT_CHARS_STEPPED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns the % of pathfinding characters skipped each frame, averaged over the last minute. The returned value corresponds to the "Characters Updated" stat in the viewer's Statistics Bar.

LibraryConstant.Name: SMOOTH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Slide in the X direction, instead of playing separate frames.

LibraryConstant.Name: SQRT2
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 1.41421356 - The square root of 2.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_BLOCK_GRAB
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls whether the object can be grabbed. A grab is the default action when in third person, and is available as the hand tool in build mode. This is useful for physical objects that you don't want other people to be able to trivially disturb. The default is FALSE

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_BLOCK_GRAB_OBJECT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Prevent click-and-drag movement on all prims in the object.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_BOUNDS_ERROR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Argument(s) passed to function had a bounds error.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_DIE_AT_EDGE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls whether the object is returned to the owners inventory if it wanders off the edge of the world. It is useful to set this status TRUE for things like bullets or rockets. The default is TRUE

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: An internal error occurred.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_MALFORMED_PARAMS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Function was called with malformed parameters.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_NOT_FOUND
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Object or other item was not found.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Feature not supported.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_OK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Result of function call was a success.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_PHANTOM
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls/indicates whether the object collides or not. Setting the value to TRUE makes the object non-colliding with all objects. It is a good idea to use this for most objects that move or rotate, but are non-physical. It is also useful for simulating volumetric lighting. The default is FALSE.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_PHYSICS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls/indicates whether the object moves physically. This controls the same flag that the UI check-box for Physical controls. The default is FALSE.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_ROTATE_Z
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls/indicates whether the object can physically rotate around the specific axis or not. This flag has no meaning for non-physical objects. Set the value to FALSE if you want to disable rotation around that axis. The default is TRUE for a physical object. A useful example to think about when visualizing the effect is a sit-and-spin device. They spin around the Z axis (up) but not around the X or Y axis.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_SANDBOX
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Controls/indicates whether the object can cross region boundaries and move more than 20 meters from its creation point. The default if FALSE.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_TYPE_MISMATCH
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Argument(s) passed to function had a type mismatch.

LibraryConstant.Name: STATUS_WHITELIST_FAILED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Whitelist Failed.

LibraryConstant.Name: TRAVERSAL_TYPE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: One of TRAVERSAL_TYPE_FAST, TRAVERSAL_TYPE_SLOW, and TRAVERSAL_TYPE_NONE.

LibraryConstant.Name: TRUE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: An integer constant for boolean comparisons. Has the value '1'.

LibraryConstant.Name: TWO_PI
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: 6.28318530 - The radians of a circle.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_FLOAT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is a float.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_INTEGER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is an integer.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_INVALID
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is invalid.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_KEY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is a key.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_ROTATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is a rotation.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_STRING
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is a string.

LibraryConstant.Name: TYPE_VECTOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The list entry is a vector.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_DEFLECTION_EFFICIENCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum (1.0) deflection of angular orientation. That is, its a simple scalar for modulating the strength of angular deflection such that the vehicles preferred axis of motion points toward its real velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_DEFLECTION_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The time-scale for exponential success of linear deflection deflection. Its another way to specify the strength of the vehicles tendency to reorient itself so that its preferred axis of motion agrees with its true velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_FRICTION_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector of timescales for exponential decay of the vehicles angular velocity about its preferred axes of motion (at, left, up). Range = [0.07, inf) seconds for each element of the vector.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_DECAY_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for exponential decay of the angular motors magnitude.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_DIRECTION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The direction and magnitude (in preferred frame) of the vehicles angular motor.The vehicle will accelerate (or decelerate if necessary) to match its velocity to its motor.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_ANGULAR_MOTOR_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for exponential approach to full angular motor velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_BANKING_EFFICIENCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between anti (-1.0), none (0.0), and maxmum (1.0) banking strength.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_BANKING_MIX
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between static (0.0) and dynamic (1.0) banking. "Static" means the banking scales only with the angle of roll, whereas "dynamic" is a term that also scales with the vehicles linear speed.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_BANKING_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for banking to exponentially approach its maximum effect. This is another way to scale the strength of the banking effect, however it affects the term that is proportional to the difference between what the banking behavior is trying to do, and what the vehicle is actually doing.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_BUOYANCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum anti-gravity (1.0).

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_GLOBAL_HEIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Hover at global height.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_TERRAIN_ONLY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Ignore water height when hovering.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_UP_ONLY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Hover does not push down. Use this flag for hovering vehicles that should be able to jump above their hover height.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_HOVER_WATER_ONLY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Ignore terrain height when hovering.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_LIMIT_MOTOR_UP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Prevents ground vehicles from motoring into the sky.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_LIMIT_ROLL_ONLY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: For vehicles with vertical attractor that want to be able to climb/dive, for instance, aeroplanes that want to use the banking feature.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_DEFLECTION_UP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: This flag prevents linear deflection parallel to world z-axis. This is useful for preventing ground vehicles with large linear deflection, like bumper cars, from climbing their linear deflection into the sky.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_FLY_UP
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Old, changed to VEHICLE_FLAG_NO_DEFLECTION_UP

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_HOVER_EFFICIENCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between minimum (0.0 = bouncy) and maximum (1.0 = fast as possible) damped motion of the hover behavior.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_HOVER_HEIGHT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The height (above the terrain or water, or global) at which the vehicle will try to hover.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_HOVER_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Period of time (in seconds) for the vehicle to achieve its hover height.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_DEFLECTION_EFFICIENCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between minimum (0.0) and maximum (1.0) deflection of linear velocity. That is, its a simple scalar for modulating the strength of linear deflection.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_DEFLECTION_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for exponential success of linear deflection deflection. It is another way to specify how much time it takes for the vehicles linear velocity to be redirected to its preferred axis of motion.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_FRICTION_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A vector of timescales for exponential decay of the vehicles linear velocity along its preferred axes of motion (at, left, up). Range = [0.07, inf) seconds for each element of the vector.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_DECAY_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for exponential decay of the linear motors magnitude.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_DIRECTION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The direction and magnitude (in preferred frame) of the vehicles linear motor. The vehicle will accelerate (or decelerate if necessary) to match its velocity to its motor. Range of magnitude = [0, 30] meters/second.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_LINEAR_MOTOR_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The timescale for exponential approach to full linear motor velocity.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_REFERENCE_FRAME
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A rotation of the vehicles preferred axes of motion and orientation (at, left, up) with respect to the vehicles local frame (x, y, z).

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_TYPE_AIRPLANE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Uses linear deflection for lift, no hover, and banking to turn. See http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_AIRPLANE

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_TYPE_BALLOON
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Hover, and friction, but no deflection. See http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_BALLOON

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_TYPE_BOAT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Hovers over water with lots of friction and some anglar deflection. See http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_BOAT

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_TYPE_CAR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Another vehicle that bounces along the ground but needs the motors to be driven from external controls or timer events. See http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_CAR

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_TYPE_SLED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Simple vehicle that bumps along the ground, and likes to move along its local x-axis. See http://wiki.secondlife.com/wiki/VEHICLE_TYPE_SLED

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_VERTICAL_ATTRACTION_EFFICIENCY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: A slider between minimum (0.0 = wobbly) and maximum (1.0 = firm as possible) stability of the vehicle to keep itself upright.

LibraryConstant.Name: VEHICLE_VERTICAL_ATTRACTION_TIMESCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The period of wobble, or timescale for exponential approach, of the vehicle to rotate such that its preferred "up" axis is oriented along the worlds "up" axis.

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_WATER_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Water Colour

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_WATER_FOG_DENSITY_EXPONENT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Water Fog Density Exponent

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Horizon Colour

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Haze Horizon

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Blue Density

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Haze Density

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Density Multiplier

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_DISTANCE_MULTIPLIER
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Distance Multiplier

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Max Altitude

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_SUN_MOON_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Sun/Moon Colour

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_AMBIENT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Ambient Colour

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_EAST_ANGLE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Sun/Position East

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_SUN_GLOW_FOCUS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Sun Glow Focus

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_SUN_GLOW_SIZE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Sun Glow Size

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_SCENE_GAMMA
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Scene Gamma

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_STAR_BRIGHTNESS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Star Brightness

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_COLOR
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Colour

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_XY_DENSITY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud X/Y/Density

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_COVERAGE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Coverage

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_SCALE
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Scale

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_DETAIL_XY_DENSITY
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Detail X/Y/Density

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_SCROLL_X
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Scroll X

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_SCROLL_Y
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Scroll Y

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_SCROLL_Y_LOCK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Scroll Y Lock

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_CLOUD_SCROLL_X_LOCK
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Cloud Scroll X Lock

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_DRAW_CLASSIC_CLOUDS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Draw Classic Clouds

LibraryConstant.Name: WL_SUN_MOON_POSITION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Windlight Sun/Moon Position

LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Target is NPC. Use this instead of NPC, Value 0x01000000

LibraryConstant.Name: OS_ATTACH_MSG_ALL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Send the message to attachments on every point

LibraryConstant.Name: OS_ATTACH_MSG_INVERT_POINTS
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Invert how the attachment points list should be treated

LibraryConstant.Name: CHANGED_ANIMATION
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: The set of animations playing on the avatar to whom this object is attached has been changed.

LibraryConstant.Name: LIST_STAT_HARMONIC_MEAN
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Returns the harmonic mean of a list of numbers, Value 100.

LibraryConstant.Name: CAMERA_FOCUS_OFFSET_Y
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Adjusts the camera focus y position relative to the target. (float)

LibraryConstant.Name: CAMERA_FOCUS_OFFSET_Z
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Adjusts the camera focus z position relative to the target. (float)

LibraryConstant.Name: CAMERA_POSITION_Y

LibraryConstant.Name: PHYS_LINKSET_TYPE_CONSTRAINT
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Bulletsim;Links are created with physics constraint objects. Used for flexible objects. Not a good default as it uses more CPU

LibraryConstant.Name: PHYS_LINKSET_TYPE_COMPOUND
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Bulletsim;Linkset is constructed as a compound object made up of the shapes of all the children. The most efficient linkset implementation and the default

LibraryConstant.Name: PHYS_LINKSET_TYPE_MANUAL
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Bulletsim;NOT IMPLEMENTED. Linkset is implemented by CPU code that moves each of the object in the linkset independently

LibraryConstant.Name: PHYS_LINK_TYPE_FIXED
LibraryConstant.DocumentationString: Bulletsim;Link is fixed and unmovable. Default. Implemented as a 6 degree-of-freedom constraint with no motion in either the linear or angular directions
